name: Family Name
description: The FN data type is used to represent family names or surnames with enhanced support for complex naming conventions. It provides components for surname, own surname prefix, own surname, surname prefix from partner/spouse, and surname from partner/spouse. This data type accommodates diverse cultural naming practices and family name structures found in international healthcare environments, supporting compound surnames and heritage naming conventions.

FN.1.name: Surname
FN.1.description: The primary surname or family name. This is the main family name component used for identification and alphabetic sorting.

FN.2.name: Own Surname Prefix
FN.2.description: A prefix that precedes the person's own surname (e.g., 'von', 'de', 'van'). Common in European naming conventions to indicate nobility, geographic origin, or family heritage.

FN.3.name: Own Surname
FN.3.description: The person's original or birth surname, separate from any married name. Used when distinguishing between birth name and current name.

FN.4.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
FN.4.description: A prefix for the surname acquired from a partner or spouse (e.g., 'de', 'von'). Used when the person has taken a partner's surname with its associated prefix.

FN.5.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
FN.5.description: The surname acquired from a partner or spouse through marriage or partnership. Supports cultures where individuals adopt their partner's family name.
